data.title: Improve Lua binding for Variant and VariantMap classes
data.body: I am not an expert in Lua but it appears to me that there are code repetition in the bindings for these two classes. I suppose one could use Lua metamethod to handle `__index` event to return a Variant from a VariantMap and so those getter and setter bindings are only required for Variant class. Currently we have an incomplete bindings and yet those incomplete bindings are repeated in two places.

data.title: Invisible controls receive keyboard events
[Feature] Allow to set manualy order to rendering queue of geometry set's for models
data.body:
This needed for proper rendering of animated-2d-model through skinned animation.
if geometries used auto ordering (by camera distance, i guess) it's produce some animation bugs like sprites overlapping in wrong z-order.(if we use one model with few geometries)

Earlier I trying to create 2d animation in blender with transparent-faces in one model. Each part(quad) have a own material for force geometry splitting by exporter (but one common sprite texture). And if i'm don't do shift by z for these character's parts(faces) and place they in same Z-cord(layer) I got overlapping sprites in engine with DiffUnlitAlpha tech. 

But if i may a have a chance, to set value(rendering order) for each geometry for  example in material editor or attribute editor for sorting this batches in model's scope in right way it' will be great for 2-d skinned.

Sorry for my bad English :)

Thanks.

data.title: [EDITOR] Icons alpha clipping issue
data.body:
Hi, I've just remarked that icons alpha transparency "work", but is not doing it smoothly. As it was "clipped" when there should be a gradation of transparency.

I've found the original PNG image and put a dark background to compare it to the icons in the runtime of the editor. If you look inside Photoshop, the icons borders are smooth, but they are not in the editor (pixelated borders). I think it's related on how the alpha channel is processed. Right now it's seem to clip (0/1) when it should put a transparency value of the alpha (0/255).

You might have to zoom in to view the difference...

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13395943/8897799/7007c294-33e9-11e5-997f-c5953bfd6894.jpg)

data.title: Expanded DDS support
data.body:
- DX10 format support (only data formats compatible, DXT-1/3/5 and RGBA + sRGB variation)
- sRGB flag on Images if indicated by DDS DXGI format
- Images may be "chained" as a list off of the first image (DDS
  cubemaps, texture arrays)
- Direct3D9 cubemap loading from DDS standard cubemap

data.title: [Feature request] EDITOR: checkbox for double sided materials
data.body: Would be nice to be able to define a double sided material from the material editor in the URHO3D editor...

data.title: EDITOR: node SCALE input make model disappear.
data.body:
While working with the editor, I've remarked this.
1. Loaded a model in the editor
2. Changed the scale values in the inspector window by inputting values directly.
3. The model disappear

If I save the scene and reload the scene the model is visible. If I slide the values using the mouse, the model doesn't disappear. It only happen when inputting values directly. If I input the values in the node scale BEFORE adding the model component, the model is visible.

Once the model have disappeared, there is no way to make it appear again, unless you reload the scene or you create another model.

data.title: [Solved] OS Exception Message Dialogs
data.body:
Hi,

So I was wondering if a feature already exist with the latest build in handling OS specific exception messages. Take for example a Checksum Error Scene where in Android it just automatically exits without any clue on what just happened. It would be nice to have a way to handle these type of messages so that users are aware of some fatal or exit errors.

Thanks.

data.title: [EDITOR] file selector doesn't return a value
data.body:
It might not be a issue as I'm new to Urho3D. Perhaps I've missed something.
I compiled a 64bit version of Urho3D and editor on Windows using MSVC 2013 community edition. The editor binary has been put in the proper folder before launching.

Description of the issue:
In the editor, when pressing the "pick" button, call a file requester, then once a file has been chosen and the OK button is pressed, there is nothing changed in the field of the editor.

I must enter the filename with the path by hand, if the filename is typed manually the file is loaded and seen in the field. Using the file requested put nothing in the field.

There is also a warning: "Cannot find resource type:" on the console output
EDIT: Ok Found the issue! I moved the files: "CoreData.pak" and "Data.pak" in the folder. This created a mixup with the editor. Moved the 2 .pak files and everything is fine now. 

This can be closed.

data.title: Smart instance
data.body:
This feature allows fast instantiate one model for StaticModelGroup.
You start with single node with one Static model within.
Then you do first pressing ( alt+d) it create a static model group with first instance of model you need to move it somewhere and  next pressing on alt+d just add new instances.
see this in work: https://youtu.be/YOGpdieVCUE

data.title: [Feature] Allow for multiple Script subsystems
data.body:
EDIT: As @friesencr just pointed out, this issue only applies to Lua, as AngelScript has already a built-in better mechanism

I think the engine would benefit from separating the "Script" subsystem and the registration of the Urho3D functions. If we abstract the common behaviour from Script in a Base class (execute function, load file, ...) and then do the registration in a derived class the programmer can derive the base class with his own separate Script API sandboxed for mods. 

That way the programmer can instantiate both subsystems at the same time, one to run the game (if he choses to program the game with one of the Scripting languages) and another one to manage his custom mod API, which can be at a higher level of abstraction than the Urho engine.

What do you think of this refactor?
